universum.studios.android.fragment

Class ActionBarFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Fragment
      • universum.studios.android.fragment.BaseFragment
        • universum.studios.android.fragment.ActionBarFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentCallbacks, ComponentCallbacks2, View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, BackPressWatcher, ViewClickWatcher
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    WebFragment

    public class ActionBarFragment
extends BaseFragment
    A BaseFragment implementation that provides API allowing to access an instance of ActionBar directly from an implementation of this class. ActionBar is accessed through the parent activity to which is a particular instance of ActionBarFragment attached. ActionBar may be obtained via getActionBar() after the parent activity has been created, so fragment's onActivityCreated(Bundle) has been called.

    Action mode

    This fragment implementation also provides logic allowing to start an action mode via startActionMode() or via startActionMode(ActionMode.Callback). Whenever a new action mode is started, onActionModeStarted(ActionMode) is invoked. To check whether fragment is currently in action mode, call isInActionMode(). The currently active action mode may be obtained via getActionMode(). Finishing of the active action mode may be done via finishActionMode() and onActionModeFinished() will be invoked immediately.

    Accepted annotations

    • @ActionBarOptions [class - inherited]

      If this annotation is presented, all options specified via this annotation will be used to set up an instance of ActionBar accessible from within context of a sub-class of ActionBarFragment. Such a set up is accomplished in BaseFragment.onViewCreated(android.view.View, Bundle).

    • @MenuOptions [class - inherited]

      If this annotation is presented, options menu will be requested in onCreate(Bundle) via Fragment.setHasOptionsMenu(boolean) and menu will be created in onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu, MenuInflater) according to the options specified via this annotation.

    • @ActionModeOptions [class - inherited]

      If this annotation is presented, the ActionMode started via startActionMode() will be configured with options menu specified via this annotation using an instance of ActionBarFragment.ActionModeCallback.

    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ActionBarFragment.ActionModeCallback
      A ActionMode.Callback basic implementation for ActionBarFragment that may be used to simplify action mode management within an implementation of such a fragment.

      • isActionBarAvailable

        protected final boolean isActionBarAvailable()
        Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the parent Activity's ActionBar is available or not.
        Returns:
        True if ActionBar obtained from the parent activity is available, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        getActionBarDelegate()

      • getActionBarDelegate

        @NonNull
protected ActionBarDelegate getActionBarDelegate()
        Returns the delegate for the ActionBar obtained from the parent activity of this fragment.

        This delegate is used by this fragment for configuration of the ActionBar.

        Returns:
        Delegate for ActionBar if the parent activity has ActionBar available, null if the ActionBar is not available.
        See Also:
        isActionBarAvailable()

      • getActionBar

        @Nullable
protected ActionBar getActionBar()
        Returns the instance of ActionBar that can be accessed by this fragment via its parent Activity.

        Note, that ActionBar can be accessed only for duration of Fragment.onAttach(android.content.Context) and BaseFragment.onDetach(), otherwise an exception will be thrown.

        Returns:
        Instance of ActionBar obtained from the parent activity or null if the parent activity does not have ActionBar available.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this fragment is not attached to its parent activity yet or it has been already detached.
        See Also:
        isActionBarAvailable()

      • getSupportActionBar

        @Nullable
protected ActionBar getSupportActionBar()
        Same as getActionBar() but this returns the instance of support ActionBar that can be accessed by this fragment only if it is presented within context of AppCompatActivity.
        Returns:
        Instance of support ActionBar obtained from the parent activity or null if the parent activity does not have ActionBar available or the activity is not an AppCompatActivity.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this fragment is not attached to its parent activity yet or it has been already detached.

      • invalidateActionBar

        public void invalidateActionBar()
        Called to invalidate ActionBar of the parent Activity according to the configuration of this fragment.

        Default implementation configures the ActionBar with options specified via @ActionBarOptions annotation (if presented).

        Inheritance hierarchies of ActionBarFragment may override this method to perform custom or additional ActionBar's invalidation.

      • startActionMode

        protected boolean startActionMode()
        Same as startActionMode(ActionMode.Callback) with a new instance of ActionBarFragment.ActionModeCallback for this fragment.

      • startActionMode

        protected boolean startActionMode(@NonNull
                                  ActionMode.Callback callback)
        Starts a new action mode for this fragment.
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback used to manage action mode.
        Returns:
        True if action mode has been started, false if this fragment is already in the action mode or the parent activity of this fragment is not available or some error occurs.
        See Also:
        isInActionMode(), BaseFragment.isAttached()

      • onActionModeStarted

        @CallSuper
protected void onActionModeStarted(@NonNull
                                               ActionMode actionMode)
        Invoked immediately after startActionMode(ActionMode.Callback) was called and this fragment was not in the action mode yet.

        Derived classes should call through to the super class's implementation of this method. If not, proper working of action mode cannot be ensured.

        Parameters:
        actionMode - Currently started action mode.

      • isInActionMode

        protected boolean isInActionMode()
        Returns a boolean flag indicating whether this fragment is in action mode or not.
        Returns:
        True if this fragment is in the action mode, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        getActionMode(), startActionMode(ActionMode.Callback)

      • getActionMode

        @Nullable
protected ActionMode getActionMode()
        Returns the current action mode (if started).
        Returns:
        The current action mode, or null if this fragment is not in action mode.
        See Also:
        isInActionMode(), startActionMode(ActionMode.Callback)

      • finishActionMode

        protected boolean finishActionMode()
        Finishes the current action mode (if started).
        Returns:
        True if action mode has been finished, false if this fragment is not in action mode.
        See Also:
        isInActionMode()

      • onActionModeFinished

        @CallSuper
protected void onActionModeFinished()
        Invoked whenever ActionBarFragment.ActionModeCallback.onDestroyActionMode(ActionMode) is called on the current action mode callback (if instance of ActionBarFragment.ActionModeCallback).

        Derived classes should call through to the super class's implementation of this method. If not, proper working of action mode cannot be ensured.

        See Also:
        finishActionMode()

      • onBackPress

        protected boolean onBackPress()
        Description copied from class: BaseFragment
        Invoked immediately after BaseFragment.dispatchBackPress() was called to process back press event.
        Overrides:
        onBackPress in class BaseFragment
        Returns:
        True if this instance of fragment has processed the back press event, false otherwise.
